intro: Poa rivulorum, commonly known as the stream meadow grass, is a perennial grass species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along stream banks, wet meadows, and other riparian habitats. Poa rivulorum plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
